workflow.name: Meraki - Setup - IP / FQDN Block list - ObjectGroup and FW rules
workflow.title: Meraki - Setup - IP / FQDN Block list - ObjectGroup and FW rules

properties.name: Meraki API Key
properties.description: Your Meraki API key. This can be generated in your Meraki dashboard

properties.name: PolicyObjectGroup IP Name
properties.description: The name of the Policy Object Group to add (Default : SecureX-IP-Blocklist)

properties.name: Organization Name
properties.description: The name of the organization to add Policy Object Group for

properties.name: PolicyObjectGroup FQDN Name
properties.description: The name of the Policy Object Group to add (Default : SecureX-FQDN-Blocklist)

This workflow create Meraki IP and FQDN Policy Object Group and FW rules for a given Organization

Target Group: Default TargetGroup

Targets: Cisco Meraki

Steps:
[] Get the Meraki API key from a global variable (optional)
[] Get Policy Objects Groups
[] Get the existing L3 firewall rules
[] Add the new L3 firewall rule
[] Update the firewall rules

More information:

actions.title: Is the block list rule already configured ?

properties.script:
import sys,json

existingRules= sys.argv[1]

existingRules = json.loads(existingRules)

newRule = {
  "comment": "SecureX Blocklist - created via API - do not modify",
  "destCidr": "GRP($workflow.definition_workflow_0215Y79WXC49C1zDLyAnfufeztvCfZjH9hx.local.variable_workflow_0216030WT0QEO1mV0Q7BgAu6TS5tWJAQetf$),GRP($workflow.definition_workflow_0215Y79WXC49C1zDLyAnfufeztvCfZjH9hx.local.variable_workflow_021603AFIXDD71I1zFH6VujotU80gWgCBZR$)",
  "destPort": "any",
  "policy": "deny",
  "protocol": "any",
  "srcCidr": "any",
  "srcPort": "any",
  "syslogEnabled": $workflow.definition_workflow_0215Y79WXC49C1zDLyAnfufeztvCfZjH9hx.local.variable_workflow_0216QEWYWZBGS2fdsvlU6VvxXD2iRVcD6eT$
  }
existingRules.insert(0, newRule)

newRules = json.dumps(existingRules)
